description: Least k such that n!+k^2 is a square.
comments: Let f=n!/4 and let x be the largest divisor of f such that x < sqrt(f). Then a(n) = f/x - x. The greatest k such that n!+k^2 is a square is f-1. The number of k for which n!+k^2 is a square is A038548(f). - _T. D. Noe_, Nov 02 2004For greatest k such that n!+k^2 is a square see A181892, for numbers x such n!+k^2=x^2 see A181896. - _Artur Jasinski_, Mar 31 2012
